1.0.0-options.description:
This controls how code is automatically formatted when using the buttons in the sidebar or formatting on save.

These user-level preferences are only applied if you do *not* have an "idl.json" file in your workspace.

quotes.title: Quote Formatting
quotes.description: For string literals what type of quote we use. Includes numbers defined using quotes.

methods.title: Method Formatting
methods.description: Do we use a dot or arrow for method invocation

keywords.title: Keyword Formatting
keywords.description: Formatting for keywords, includes binary keywords

properties.title: Property Formatting
properties.description: Controls if properties are upper or lower case

control.title: Control Formatting
control.description: How are control statements, such as "for", "if", "pro", formatted

numbers.title: Number Formatting
numbers.description: Controls accents to letters that set the data type and their case

hex.title: Hex Number Formatting
hex.description: Indicates formatting for hexadecimal (hex) numbers (either defined with quotes or "0x")

octal.title: Octal Number Formatting
octal.description: Indicates formatting for octal numbers (either defined with quotes or "0o")

binary.title: Binary Number Formatting
binary.description: Indicates formatting for binary numbers (either defined with quotes or "0b")

routines.title: Routine Formatting
routines.description: When we encounter a known routine (function, procedure, and method), how do we format it with respect to the definition

localVariables.title: Local Variable Formatting
localVariables.description: If local variables match the case for the first instance that we find
